meanings.definition: Allowing liquid or gas to pass through a crack or hole.
meanings.sent1: The old bucket was leaky and dripped water slowly.
meanings.sent2: The leaky faucet wasted a lot of water every day.
meanings.sent3: The leaky balloon made funny noises as it deflated.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was leaky, forgetting important details easily.
meanings.sent5: The leaky roof made the whole house damp and musty.

meanings.sent1: The leaky boat needed constant repairs to stay afloat.
meanings.sent2: The leaky pipe caused a flood in the basement.
meanings.sent3: The leaky umbrella was useless in the rain.
meanings.sent4: His leaky excuses couldn't cover up the truth for long.
meanings.sent5: The leaky tire made the journey more challenging with frequent stops.
